intro: Tetrataenium, commonly known as the small-leafed tetrataenium, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Tetrataenium species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value. Their botanical structure includes a fibrous root system and herbaceous stems that may be either upright or trailing.
